abstract.text: Customize appearance information directly on the navigation bar object.

inlineContent.text: In iOS 13 and later, customize your navigation bar using the
properties. You may continue to use these legacy accessors to customize your navigation barâ€™s appearance directly, but you must update the appearance for different bar configurations yourself.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
Defines the stylistic appearance of different types of views.
Navigational controls that display in a bar along the top of the screen, usually in conjunction with a navigation controller.
The image shown beside the Back button.
The image used as a mask for content during push and pop transitions.
Returns the background image for given bar metrics.
Returns the background image to use for a given bar position and set of metrics.
The navigation bar style that specifies its appearance.
The tint color to apply to the navigation bar background.
The appearance settings for a compact-height navigation bar.
The appearance settings for a compact-height navigation bar when the edge of scrollable content aligns with the edge of the navigation bar.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the navigation bar is translucent.
Display attributes for the barâ€™s large title text.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the title displays in a large format.
The appearance settings for the navigation bar when the edge of scrollable content aligns with the edge of the navigation bar.
Sets the background image for given bar metrics.
Sets the background image to use for a given bar position and set of metrics.
Sets the titleâ€™s vertical position adjustment for given bar metrics.
The shadow image to be used for the navigation bar.
The appearance settings for a standard-height navigation bar.
The tint color to apply to the navigation items and bar button items.
Display attributes for the barâ€™s title text.
Returns the titleâ€™s vertical position adjustment for given bar metrics.
Create custom titles, prompts, and buttons in your appâ€™s navigation bar.
Manage your interface using view controllers and facilitate navigation around your appâ€™s content.
Present your content onscreen and define the interactions allowed with that content.
